conclusion: Determine the velocity of ions after velocity selector and charge-to-mass ratio from magnetic analyzer.
Electric field E is directed vertically upwards in the velocity selector.
Magnetic field B is directed outward perpendicular to the plane of the paper in the velocity selector.
Electric force on the ion is qE.
Magnetic force on the ion is qvB.
For ion to pass without deflection, qE = qvB, thus v = E/B.
Ions travel in a circular path due to magnetic field in the magnetic analyzer.
Balance of centripetal force and magnetic force gives qvB = mv^2/R.
Solving for R gives R = mv/qB.
Using v = E/B, R = m(E/B)/qB = mE/qB^2.
Ions pass through a quarter-circular ring with inner radius R1 and outer radius R2 in the magnetic analyzer.
Charge-to-mass ratio range is E/BR2 <= q/m <= E/BR1.
Velocity of ions is v = E/B.
Charge-to-mass ratio range is E/BR2 <= q/m <= E/BR1.
